intro: Tetracera surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam tetracera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, typical of the genus Tetracera. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
